description: Debug and testing utilities for appointment colors, database tickets, and development testing

components.AppointmentColorTestApp: Debug MaterialApp for testing appointment status colors and visual appearance.

components.AppointmentColorDemo: Demo widget displaying color swatches for different appointment statuses.

rules: Debug utility for testing appointment color schemes and visual consistency.
Comprehensive status testing: scheduled, confirmed, arrived, in-service, completed.
Pastel color palette with soft backgrounds and appropriate contrast ratios.
Border color system using alpha transparency (0.3) for subtle visual separation.
Text color coordination with darker variants for optimal readability.
Sample appointment generation with realistic duration and service data.
Visual color swatch display showing background, border, and text color combinations.
Color functions mirroring actual calendar grid implementation for accuracy.
Status-based color mapping ensuring consistent visual identification.
Duration display integration showing appointment length with color coding.
Professional color scheme suitable for business appointment scheduling.
Main function integration allowing standalone execution for color testing.
Rounded container styling with 6px border radius for modern appearance.
Center-aligned text display with bold weight for clear status identification.
Color testing workflow enabling rapid visual verification of appointment themes.
Development tool for validating color accessibility and visual hierarchy.

components.DatabaseTicketsDebugger: Static debug utility for comprehensive tickets database analysis and troubleshooting.

rules: Comprehensive database debugging tool for ticket data analysis and troubleshooting.
Table structure inspection using PRAGMA table_info for column verification.
Total ticket count verification with direct SQL queries for data validation.
Raw database data examination comparing direct SQL access with repository methods.
Repository testing with DriftTicketRepository.instance initialization and method calls.
Status-based filtering tests for queued, assigned, in-service, completed, and paid tickets.
Error logging integration with detailed debugging information and stack traces.
Database initialization verification ensuring proper PosDatabase setup.
Data discrepancy detection comparing direct database queries with repository results.
Column metadata analysis showing data types and nullable constraints.
First 10 tickets raw data inspection for manual data verification.
Repository method testing with various filter combinations and limits.
Success/error reporting with clear emoji indicators for quick status identification.
Debugging workflow supporting systematic database troubleshooting processes.
ignore_for_file directive allowing print statements for debug output.
Static method design enabling easy integration into debugging workflows.
